title: Level 1 Space Practice Test
description: Test your skills with 2D shapes, 3D shapes, directions, and turns!

questions.question: Which of these is a 3D shape?
questions.explanation: A cube is a 3D shape -- it is solid and you can hold it. Circle, square, and triangle are all 2D (flat) shapes that you can draw on paper.

questions.question: How many faces does a cube have?
questions.explanation: A cube has 6 faces: top, bottom, front, back, left side, and right side. All 6 faces are squares.

questions.question: What 3D shape looks like a ball?
questions.explanation: A sphere is the 3D shape that looks like a ball. It is round with no flat faces, no edges, and no corners.

questions.question: You are facing forward. You make a half turn. Where are you facing now?
questions.explanation: A half turn means you spin halfway around. You end up facing the opposite direction from where you started.

questions.question: A tin can is shaped like which 3D shape?
questions.explanation: A tin can has two flat circle faces (top and bottom) and a curved surface around the middle. This is a cylinder.

questions.question: You make a full turn. Where are you facing?
questions.explanation: A full turn means you spin all the way around -- 360 degrees. You end up facing the exact same direction you started.

questions.question: How many sides does a hexagon have?
questions.explanation: A hexagon has 6 sides and 6 corners. 'Hex' means six!

questions.question: What 2D shape are the flat faces of a cylinder?
questions.explanation: A cylinder has two flat faces, and both of them are circles. Think of the top and bottom of a tin can -- they are circles!

questions.question: You are facing a tree. You make a quarter turn to the right. Are you now facing the tree, or something else?
questions.explanation: A quarter turn means you turn to face a direction to your side. After turning a quarter to the right, you are no longer facing the tree -- you are facing something to your right.

questions.question: Is a triangle a 2D shape or a 3D shape?
questions.explanation: A triangle is a 2D (flat) shape. You can draw it on paper. It has 3 sides and 3 corners but no thickness.
